meanings.definition: The act of propitiating or appeasing a god, spirit, or person.
meanings.sent1: The propitiation of the angry deity involved a ritual sacrifice.
meanings.sent2: The villagers made a propitiation to the forest spirits to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The propitiation ceremony turned into a lively celebration with music and dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a propitiation that calmed the storm in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The propitiation of the volcano god was necessary to prevent an eruption.

meanings.definition: Something that propitiates; a propitiatory gift or offering.
meanings.sent1: The traveler presented a propitiation to the innkeeper as a token of gratitude.
meanings.sent2: The propitiation left at the shrine was a symbol of peace and goodwill.
meanings.sent3: The propitiation of chocolates brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: His apology served as a propitiation for his earlier mistake.
meanings.sent5: The propitiation of flowers was a gesture of reconciliation between the neighbors.
